Identification_Area.title: ASTEROID ALBEDOS FROM STELLAR OCCULTATIONS V1.0

Modification_Detail.description: extracted metadata from PDS3 catalog and modified to comply with PDS4 Information Model

External_Reference.reference_text: Belskaya, I.N. and V.G. Shevchenko, Opposition effect of asteroids, Icarus 147, 94-105, 2000.

Bowell, E., B. Hapke, D. Domingue, K. Lumme, J. Peltoniemi, and A.W. Harris, Application of photometric models to asteroids, in Asteroids II, edited by R.P. Binzel, T. Gehrels, and M.S. Matthews, pp. 524-556, Univ. of Arizona Press, Tucson, 1989.
Cellino, A., R. Gil-Hutton, E.F. Tedesco, M. DiMartino, and A. Brunini, Polarimetric observations of small asteroids: Preliminary results, Icarus 138, 129-140, 1999.
Dunham, D. W. and Herald, D., Asteroid Occultations. EAR-A-3-RDR-OCCULTATIONS-V3.0. NASA Planetary Data System, 2005.
Lupishko, D.F., and R.A. Mohamed, A New Calibration of the Polarimetric Albedo Scale of Asteroids, Icarus 119, 209-213, 1996.
Shevchenko, V.G. and D.F. Lupishko, Optical properties of asteroids from photometric observations, Solar System Res. 32, 220-232, 1998.
Shevchenko, V.G. and E.F. Tedesco, Asteroid albedos deduced from stellar occultations, Icarus 184, 211-220, 2006.
Shevchenko, V.G., Photometry of asteroids: Phase dependences of brightness and photometric model, Ph.D. thesis, Kharkov University, 1997.
Tedesco, E.F., P.V. Noah, M. Noah, and S.D. Price, The Supplemental IRAS Minor Planet Survey. Astronomical Journal 123, 1056-1085, 2002.

Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: ASTEROID ALBEDOS FROM STELLAR OCCULTATIONS V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Shevchenko, V.G. and Tedesco, E.F., Asteroid Albedos from Stellar Occultations V1.0. EAR-A-VARGBDET-5-OCCALB-V1.0. NASA Planetary Data System, 2007.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: Asteroid albedos derived from stellar occultations, from Schevchenko and Tedesco (2006).
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: This data set contains albedos for 57 asteroids determined from diameters obtained from stellar occultations. These albedos are from Shevchenko and Tedesco (2006).
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= These albedos for 57 asteroids from stellar occultation diameters are published in Shevchenko and Tedesco (2006) [SHEVCHENKO&TEDES2006]. This data set is reproduced from Table 1 of that paper. The albedos are derived from the stellar occultation diameters compiled in the file occdiam.tab in version 3.0 of the PDS asteroid occultations data set, Dunham, D. W. and Herald, D., Asteroid Occultations. EAR-A-3-RDR-OCCULTATIONS-V3.0. NASA Planetary Data System, 2005 [DUNHAM&HERALD2005]. Error bars for the occultation diameters are provided in that file.
Also included in the data set are the aspect data of the asteroids at the time of the occultation and the other parameters involved in the derivation.
For a full description of the derivation of the albedos and a discussion of the results, see the original paper, Shevchenko and Tedesco (2006).
Shevchenko, V.G. and E.F. Tedesco, Asteroid albedos deduced from stellar occultations, Icarus 184, 211-220, 2006.
Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Confidence Level Overview ========================= Quality codes for the occultation diameters and absolute magnitudes on which the albedos are based are given in the data set. For further information about the confidence level of the data, see the original paper, Shevchenko and Tedesco (2006).
